subject: Horse Racing
Horses
lead_paragraph: Mon Mome, a 100-1 shot, won the Grand National at Aintree Racecourse in England on Saturday, capturing the world’s most famous steeplechase by 12 lengths. Mon Mome, a 9-year-old horse, was ridden by Liam Treadwell in the grueling four-and-a-half-mile test. Mon Mome was the biggest long-shot winner since Foinavon in 1967, who also went off at 100-1. The winner pulled away after jumping the last of the 30 fences in the 162nd running of the race.
